New Records: Tim David hit 4 off the last ball to give Australia a nail-biting six-wicket victory over New Zealand in the first Twenty20 international in Wellington on Wednesday.
Key Match Events: Rachin Ravindra had earlier put New Zealand in the driving seat by hitting 68 runs off 35 balls
Marsh built a partnership of 42 for the third wicket with Glenn Maxwell
New Zealand's fielding let them down in the 12th over
Adam Milne was smashed for 19 runs in the penultimate over
Australia needed 15 from the last six balls, but David held his nerve by smashing a six before sending the final ball of the night to the boundary past a diving Phillips.
Pre-Game Insights: The three-match series is the last for both teams before the T20 World Cup in the United States and West Indies in June.
Post-Match Reflections: Mitchell Marsh admitted, 'I thought we were done, to be honest.'
Mitchell Santner said of Australia, 'I thought we didn't bowl too bad, but the power they possess all the way down is the reason why they are pretty good.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series moves to Auckland with the next two T20 internationals both to be played at Eden Park, on Friday and Sunday, before a two-Test series.
Others: Veteran David Warner was booed off the pitch after being caught by Glenn Phillips for 32 in the sixth over.
